moves.1. e4: This is a nice quick game, where i believe the sicilian develops a bit too slowly for black
the first non-database move attempting to open his kingside
moves.5... Nc6 6. exf6 gxf6: Nxf6 is better here, because it develops the knight and attempts to close down the kingside
moves.7. Bf4 Nge7: now he has to waste an extra move developing the knight that should have gone to f6
moves.8. dxc5: grabbing the pawn that the knight move freed up, again move 6 returns to haunt him
moves.9. Nxd5: clearing out defenders from the kingside and winning a pawn
moves.9... exd5 10. Qxd5 Nb4: do you see the force mate? try not to look at the notation first
moves.12... Ke6 13. Nd4#: bam! game over! notice how white has three active pieces and an advanced pawn while black only has an oddly positioned knight in the game
